Title: the killer robot instability

Scene: The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
Howard: All right, that’s the last servo. Behold the Mobile Omnidirectional Neutralization and Termination Eradicator. Or…

Featuring one articulated razor-sharp killing saw, one polycarbonate grinding and flipping wheel, steel armour plate exoskeleton top and bottom, and enough horsepower to drive a 110 pounds of mechanized death from zero to holy crap in 4.8 seconds.
All right, enough chitchat, let’s destroy something.
Gentlemen, goggles.
Oh yeah, they still got the full Monte.
It’s a big deal. There’s an awards banquet and a dance afterward. Perhaps you’d like to come with me. I know the other fellas would be really excited to see a girl there.
Well, that may be a slight exaggeration. You’d be the only doable girl.
How is doable anything but a compliment?
Please, Leonard, not now. Once again, Penny and I have begun our little tango.
The carnal repartee, the erotic to and fro. But as delicious as the appetizer might be, at some point we will have to succumb and eat the entree while it’s still… hot.
Um, so what are you saying?
Wait a minute. This isn’t flirting, you’re serious.
Thanks for the heads up.
I’m going home to live my creepy, pathetic life.
Here’s a crazy idea, Ma, answer it!
I don’t go to school, Ma. I work at a university.
I don’t want to talk to anybody.
I don’t have homework. I’m a grown man with a master’s degree in engineering!
Cherry, please!
You make me want to kill myself.
Who?
I don’t want to talk to her.
Ma!
I’m fine.
People move away from her on the bus. What do you want?
Fine, you’re sorry. Good-bye.
Hey, I’m a big boy. I’m not traumatized by some random comment from some random woman. I mean, get over yourself.

And then, when I was 14, I met Marcy Grossman. She was so beautiful. She just got her braces off but they left a little of the overbite. It was so hot, like a sexy little chipmunk. I didn’t have the courage to ask her out, but I dedicated a song to her at the ninth grade talent show.
Marcy Grossman is sunshine, on a cloudy day, when it’s cold outside, Marcy Grossman is the month of May…
I guess you’d say, what can make me feel this way, Marcy Grossman, Marcy Grossman, Marcy Grossman, Talkin’ ’bout Marcy…
Grossman.
And then she came up with that sexy little chipmunk mouth and spit in my hair. Which brings us to tenth grade.
Look at me. What chance do I have if I don’t try too hard?
I guess.
You really think so?
I don’t know.
Yes, I slipped and fell. In the bathroom. Bounced right off the tub.
Yeah. They sucker punch you when your eyes are closed.
Oh, no. A little electrical tape, some solder. Are you insane? I’ve seen space probes that crashed into the desert that were in better shape than this.
Well, don’t get the wrong idea. The way I see it, I’m halfway to pity sex.
Sheldon: Is it wrong to say I love our killer robot?
Did it when I was four. It’s an icosahedral dye floating in tinted blue water.
What did the toaster oven ever do to you?
Yeah, this is an auspicious moment. Yeah, like Robert Oppenheimer or Neil Armstrong, we need the appropriate words to mark this historic scientific event.
If it wanted to kill you, you’d be dead.
I’m sorry, are you unaware of the upcoming Southern California Robot Fighting League Round Robin Invitational?
Yeah, excuse me, Penny, but in this room, you’re the one who’s peculiar.
His name is Monte.

Leonard, I believe it is. This is trash talk, and trash talk is a traditional component in all sporting events. Kripke, your robot is inferior and it will be defeated by ours because ours exceeds yours in both design and execution. Also, I’m given to understand that your mother is overweight.
Now, of course, if that is the result of a glandular condition and not sloth and gluttony, I withdraw that comment.
There are boundaries.
What do you mean?
We accept your challenge. Name a time and place.
Make it so.
We don’t have that option, we’ve accepted the challenge. We can’t run away from a fight.
Impressive as that may be, Monte is not us. Monte has no fear.
You are overlooking the fact that we now know what we’re up against and we can modify Monte so that he’s prepared.
Have faith, gentlemen. We don’t need Wolowitz, engineering is merely the slow younger brother of physics. Watch and learn. Do either of you know how to open the toolbox?
No, Leonard. For years, merciless thugs like Kripke have made my life a series of painful noogies and humiliating wedgies and the insensitively named Indian burns. That stops now.
What you fail to realize is Kripke suffers from a fatal flaw, overconfidence from his robot’s massive size and its overwhelming power.
Trust me, Kripke will fall easy prey to my psychological warfare. Observe. Kripke! I would ask if your robot is prepared to meet its maker, but as you are its maker, clearly the two of you have met.
He’s right, Leonard. The paradigm is to the death.
Never. I’d rather see Monte dead than in your hands.
Do it.
Indeed. We are prepared for anything he can throw at us. (A flame begins to jet out of Kripke’s robot.) That’s new.
Don’t hurt us, don’t hurt us,
I did this. Monte was killed by my hubris and my pride. No matter what anybody says, this is my fault.
So what do you think, Howard? It’s not that bad, right?
You’re right. Monte’s gone. We’ll bury him in the morning. A simple ceremony. I’ll speak. Leonard, you’ll play your cello.
Just a toy robot?
Raj: As with my father, I both love and fear it.
Okay. What shall be first to taste the wrath of Monte?
Okay. Ooh, perhaps today is the day we finally find out what’s inside the Magic Eight Ball.
Man, call spoiler alert before you say things like that.
How about “Die, toaster, die”?
What’s going on?

I’m not surprised. Despite his hard and crusty shell, Howard is a very sensitive man. Do you know he writes poetry? Mostly about men from Nantucket and hermits named Dave, but he does it with real sensitivity.
Oh, snap.
What difference does it make? Fat is fat.
He’s depressed because he’s pathetic and creepy and he can’t get girls.
I’m curious, what part of America is that accent from?
I can’t watch anymore.
Sheldon, did we all not just watch the same video? Kripke’s robot just had angry sex with a mid-sized automobile.
Excuse me, but how are we going to make any modifications without Wolowitz? Have you heard from Penny yet?
But, Sheldon, we don’t have a chance. The only improvement you were able to make on the robot was to put fresh batteries in the remote.
That’s not overconfidence, that’s observation.
Way to bust out the Jedi mind tricks, dude.
Come on, Sheldon, you got this.
Go, Monte! Go Monte!
No one’s arguing with you, dude.
Leonard: Maybe we should start small.
How about the toaster oven?
What did I ever do to Jimmy Mullins in the third grade? He still punched me in the face with my own fists. Sorry, you little nerd, you were just in the wrong boys’ room at the wrong time.
That’ll do it.
Uh-huh?
Killer robot. We built it.
Howard, why don’t we just work on the robot?
I’m begging you, stop talking.
Howard, where you going?
Wow.
He said maybe we should enter you in the killer robot competition.
I don’t know, now they’re just yelling about Popsicles. Sounds like Penny really got to him.
Yes, we did, Kripke.
Come on, is that really necessary?
No, don’t make it so. Barry, we can’t fight you tomorrow, our engineer is incapacitated.
Hey, you got a minute?
I need you to apologize to How…
Come on. Wolowitz won’t come out of his house and we need him for a robot battle.
The robot didn’t hurt his feelings.
He’s been in bed for two days.
He’s not with a… does it really matter who or what he’s with? The guy is devastated.
Okay, don’t take this as a criticism, but you kind of have that overexposed-to-gamma-rays thing going on.
You know, like, most of the time, you’re the easygoing Bruce Banner, but then, when you get angry, you kind of turn into, like, you know, grrrrr!
Seriously? Gamma rays? Bruce Banner? You didn’t get The Incredible Hulk from that? Never mind, just, please go talk to him.
Well, maybe you can go at it from a different angle, like, um, you see a glimmer of goodness in him and you only said what you said because you want to nurture it and make it shine.

Okay, let’s try it this way. Remember the day that we first met and you asked me to go to your boyfriend’s apartment to get your TV back and he was nine feet tall and he took my pants off and you said… what was that? What did you say? Oh, yes, you said you owed me one.
I came home with no pants.
Thank you. I should probably give you a heads up about his mother.
She’s a delightful woman. You’ll love her.
Oh, my God. That’s Kripke’s robot?
Sheldon, we have to call it off.
Oh, please, we’ve spent our whole lives running away from fights. Personally, I can squeeze through a hole in a fence half my size.
You want to prepare him? Install a bladder and a pair of shorts so he can wet himself.
Not yet.
Nice little bot you’ve got here.
What’s this do, spin?
Neat. Good work. Sheldon, we’ve got to call this off.
I just want to make sure that we’re all clear, standard robotic fighting league rules apply.
Run, Monte, run!
Go, go, go, go!
Well, so much for making up for the emotional wounds of childhood.
Forget the robot. What happened to you?
Penny.
Penny: No, I think I’m just going to stay in tonight and do laundry. (Monte bursts through boys door. Penny screams and runs down the stairs.)
Leonard?
What the hell?
Yeah, well, it almost killed me.
So, who exactly does it want to kill?
You know, since I moved last year, not all my mail has been forwarded.
How is it supposed to be a dance if I’m the only girl?
You’re a pig, Howard.
Our tango?
Look, normally I can just ignore you. I mean, I get it, you’re a little peculiar. You know, like Sheldon.
Yeah, you might be right. But back to you. I know you think you’re some sort of smooth-talking ladies’ man, but the truth is, you are just pathetic and creepy.

I am saying it is not a compliment to call me doable. It’s not sexy to stare at my ass and say, “Ooh, it must be jelly ’cause jam don’t shake like that.” And most important, we are not dancing a tango, we’re not to’ing and fro’ing. Nothing is ever going to happen between us. Ever.
Flirting? You think I’m flirting with you? I am not flirting with you, no woman is ever gonna flirt with you, you’re just gonna grow old and die alone.
Well, someone had to say it. (Raj whispers in Leonard’s ear) What?
Hey.
Yeah, come on in. What’s up?
Get out.
Well, then have the robot go and get him.
His feelings needed to be hurt.
Yeah, probably with a blow-up doll.
Oh, please, how could I possibly devastate Howard?
What does that mean?
I turn into a bear?
And say what? That I didn’t mean it, because I meant it.
Oh, pthththth.
Okay, come on, that’s not fair.
Fine, I’ll go over there tomorrow.
What about her?
So, I just came by to see how you were doing.
Good. Your mom seems nice.
Okay, look. Howard, I just want to apologize for some things that I have said. About you. I’ve been informed that you have feelings. And apparently, I have hurt them. So, I’m sorry. Howard.
So, you’re okay?
Okay. Well, bye. (Penny leaves room. Sound of Howard crying through door.) So close (goes back in.)
Aw, that sounds sweet.
Oh, it’s cute.
That’s great.
Oh, it’s fun.
Howard, do you think maybe sometimes you try too hard?
Well, you’d have a terrific chance. I mean, you’re smart, you’re funny, you have a cool job. You build stuff that goes into outer space.
Look, I’m telling you, I’ve known you for, like, a year and a half and this is the first time I feel like I’m talking to a real person. And you know what? I like him, he’s a nice guy.
Yes.
I do. (Howard tries to kiss her. She punches him.)
He slipped and fell.
Yes, now he knows what bathtubs are capable of doing when you don’t treat them with respect.
Sheldon, honey, aren’t you getting a little carried away? I mean, it’s just a toy robot.
I know, I got it. Sheldon, I’m sorry.
Howard\u2019s Mother (voice): Hello? All right, hold on. It’s your friend, Leonard! He wants to know why you’re not at school today!
That’s a school! Now pick up the phone!
Should I ask Leonard to bring over your homework?!
Excuse me, Mr. Fancy-Pants. Want me to get you a Popsicle?
I ate the cherry. All that’s left is green.
Howard, there’s a blonde girl, Patsy, here to see you!
Okay, now she’s saying it’s Penny.
She ran past me. Was I supposed to tackle her?
Kripke (arriving): Hey, Hofstadter. Word around the pwasma wab is you built a wobot?
Kripke: Well, if you have any dewusions about entewing him against my wobot, the Kwipke Kwippler in the Southern California Wobot Fighting League Wound Wobin Invitational, aka the S.C.aw.F.L.aw.aw.I., his name is gonna be Swrap Metal.
Tell you what, forget the S.C.aw.F.L.aw.aw.I., let’s settle this woboto a woboto.
There’s no guawantee we’ve gotta go against each other in the Wound Wobin, so let’s thwow down. You know, unless you’re afwaid.
Tomowow, thwee o’clock, the kinetics wab.
We’re all pathetic and cweepy and can’t get girls, that’s why we fight wobots. If you’re not there, you’ll be exposed to widicule.
Yep. At 3400 RPM. It can cut through steel like it was wubber.
Are you cwazy? This is a stweet fight, the stweet has no rules.
I will, however, give you the opportunity to concede my supewiowity now and offer me your wobot as the spoils of war.
That could be easily awanged. Weady, set, go?
Kripke (voice): As you can see, the Kwippler is weducing the Chevy Cavawier to wubble.
Howard (arriving): I got your text. How bad is… Oy.

Um, so what are you saying?

Flirting? You think I’m flirting with you? I am not flirting with you, no woman is ever gonna flirt with you, you’re just gonna grow old and die alone.
I’m going home to live my creepy, pathetic life.

He said maybe we should enter you in the killer robot competition.
Here’s a crazy idea, Ma, answer it!
Hello? All right, hold on. It’s your friend, Leonard! He wants to know why you’re not at school today!
I don’t go to school, Ma. I work at a university.
That’s a school! Now pick up the phone!
I don’t want to talk to anybody.
Should I ask Leonard to bring over your homework?!
I don’t have homework. I’m a grown man with a master’s degree in engineering!
Excuse me, Mr. Fancy-Pants. Want me to get you a Popsicle?
I ate the cherry. All that’s left is green.
You make me want to kill myself.

I don’t know, now they’re just yelling about Popsicles. Sounds like Penny really got to him.

I’m curious, what part of America is that accent from?
Yeah, come on in. What’s up?
I need you to apologize to How…
Come on. Wolowitz won’t come out of his house and we need him for a robot battle.
Well, then have the robot go and get him.
The robot didn’t hurt his feelings.

Okay, come on, that’s not fair.
I came home with no pants.
Fine, I’ll go over there tomorrow.
Thank you. I should probably give you a heads up about his mother.
She’s a delightful woman. You’ll love her.
Howard, there’s a blonde girl, Patsy, here to see you!
Okay, now she’s saying it’s Penny.
I don’t want to talk to her.
She ran past me. Was I supposed to tackle her?
So, I just came by to see how you were doing.
People move away from her on the bus. What do you want?

Hey, I’m a big boy. I’m not traumatized by some random comment from some random woman. I mean, get over yourself.
Okay. Well, bye. (Penny leaves room. Sound of Howard crying through door.) So close (goes back in.)

I do. (Howard tries to kiss her. She punches him.)
Nice little bot you’ve got here.
Yep. At 3400 RPM. It can cut through steel like it was wubber.
Neat. Good work. Sheldon, we’ve got to call this off.

Don’t hurt us, don’t hurt us,
The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
Well, so much for making up for the emotional wounds of childhood.
I did this. Monte was killed by my hubris and my pride. No matter what anybody says, this is my fault.
No one’s arguing with you, dude.
I got your text. How bad is… Oy.
Forget the robot. What happened to you?
Yes, I slipped and fell. In the bathroom. Bounced right off the tub.
Yes, now he knows what bathtubs are capable of doing when you don’t treat them with respect.
Yeah. They sucker punch you when your eyes are closed.
So what do you think, Howard? It’s not that bad, right?
Oh, no. A little electrical tape, some solder. Are you insane? I’ve seen space probes that crashed into the desert that were in better shape than this.
You’re right. Monte’s gone. We’ll bury him in the morning. A simple ceremony. I’ll speak. Leonard, you’ll play your cello.
Sheldon, honey, aren’t you getting a little carried away? I mean, it’s just a toy robot.
I know, I got it. Sheldon, I’m sorry.
Well, don’t get the wrong idea. The way I see it, I’m halfway to pity sex.
